quest.name: Thank Heavensturn for You
journal:
Having sent you hotfooted on a mission, the uma bugyo is eager to know the results.
※This quest is available for a limited time only.

The uma bugyo bids you advocate for an unknown mount, the horse, in Gridania, Limsa Lominsa, and Ul'dah, and bring back a kabuto from each as a token of your success. You may visit the cities in any order, but the three kabuto must be presented to the uma bugyo starting with Gridania. Obtain and don the golden uma kabuto, and present yourself to the uma bugyo.

※Please note that you will be unable to complete this quest after the seasonal event has ended. For details, please check the Lodestone.
You have donned the golden uma kabuto, thus proving your success in Gridania. Obtain and don the crimson uma kabuto in Limsa Lominsa, and present yourself to the uma bugyo.
You have donned the crimson uma kabuto, thus proving your success in Limsa Lominsa. Obtain and don the black uma kabuto in Ul'dah, and present yourself to the uma bugyo.

You have donned the black uma kabuto, thus proving your success in Ul'dah. Your advocacy complete in all three city–states, you must now quell opposition by speaking with ordinary Gridanians who are favorably disposed toward the horse. Grace your head with the stately uma kabuto once more, then set about gathering those words.
You have found three Gridanians who support the introduction of horses to their land. Stay in character as the horse, and speak with the head of the Fraternal Order of Chocowackers.

You have relayed the voice of the people, but the chief chocowacker is less than tractable. In fact, she declares she will send for a chocobo fine enough to put the uma bugyo in her place. Diplomatically report the developments to the uma bugyo.

Despite your calm retelling of the chief chocowacker's words, the uma bugyo is much offended, and has accepted the challenge set forth. Hide your dismay behind your kabuto and speak with the chocowacker at Treespeak Stables.

The encounter between the uma bugyo and the chief chocowacker quickly devolves into a war of words. However, a mysterious stranger arrives just in time to avert an escalation from insult to injury. Return to Gridania and speak with the uma bugyo.

The uma bugyo thanks you for all you have done, and reveals that she will work with the chocowackers to find a way for horses and chocobos to coexist. Someday, the horse may be a common sight in Eorzea─but the horse that you were will never be forgotten.
objectives: While wearing the golden uma kabuto, speak with the uma bugyo.
While wearing the crimson uma kabuto, speak with the uma bugyo.
While wearing the black uma kabuto, speak with the uma bugyo.
While wearing the uma kabuto, speak of horses in New Gridania.
While wearing the uma kabuto, speak of horses in Old Gridania.
While wearing the uma kabuto, speak with the chief chocowacker.
While wearing the uma kabuto, speak with the uma bugyo.
While wearing the uma kabuto, speak with the chief chocowacker at Treespeak Stables.

dialogue.name: HORSEMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: Yours is to advocate for the noble horse in Gridania, Limsa Lominsa, and Ul'dah. They that look to me for wrath and succor already toil in those cities three.

dialogue.name: HORSEMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: If your efforts bear fruit, a kabuto of colors varied you shall have. Gather all three─golden, black, and crimson─and present yourself before me in a manner customary for such occasions.

dialogue.name: HORSEMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: Now, m'ladym'lord, know that in the East, the journey belongs to the womanman but the destination to herhis master. This pageant of kabuto must follow an order proper, but the quests are yours to order as you like.

dialogue.name: HORSEMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: We must begin with gold, for it opens that chamber of the heart where sings the canary of covetise. Do not be baffled, m'ladym'lord: we of the East make a place for our desires.

dialogue.name: HORSEMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: I see and mark the golden uma kabuto. Let us agree that Gridania has been tutored in the beauty of the horse.

dialogue.name: HORSEMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: That which is called beauty by the base and the fine alike is but a dream of a song, and through every one echoes a hoofbeat...in Eorzea now as well as the Far East.

dialogue.name: HORSEMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: Now comes red, for we must remember, m'ladym'lord, that where gold goes, blood follows. The crimson uma kabuto of Limsa Lominsa awaits an advocate worthy.

dialogue.name: HORSEMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: I see that your head wears not the golden uma kabuto of Gridania, and so the pageant is not yet complete. Offer yourself in amity and perspicacity to yon golden uma yoriki.

dialogue.name: HORSEMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: I see and mark the crimson uma kabuto. Let us assent that Limsa Lominsa has learned of the power of the horse.

dialogue.name: HORSEMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: Prodigal it is that a doshin fell in the line of duty. Were it not for m'lady'sm'lord's assistance, these Lominsans would see not the horse as a helpmeet.

dialogue.name: HORSEMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: The pageant must end in black, betokening a darkling of the senses that the bold and the craven alike call death. M'ladyM'lord knows I speak of the black uma kabuto of Ul'dah.

dialogue.name: HORSEMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: I neither see nor mark the crimson uma kabuto of Limsa Lominsa upon your crown. Such a kabuto will be your due, m'ladym'lord, when the red uma yoriki receives your help.

dialogue.name: HORSEMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: I see and mark the black uma kabuto. Let us accept the schooling of Ul'dah as a deed of speed, done and dealt.

dialogue.name: HORSEMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: The speed of the horse is a grace unmatched! That which is named Ul'dah, m'ladym'lord, is but a millstone that grinds in the desert. Sorely in need it is of such grace.

dialogue.name: HORSEMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: Gold, crimson, black. Noted and marked, and so the pageant is complete. Let us to another matter attend. Tongues waggle and curiosity piques about the horse, such is m'lady'sm'lord's success.

dialogue.name: HORSEMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: Yet, others would deny their fellow Eorzeans even the mildest flirtation with the horse, m'ladym'lord, and here it is that we must strike.

dialogue.name: HORSEMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: Those they call the “Fraternal Order of Chocowackers”, in the harsh accents of Eorzea, are the fronds that fan the flames. In their iron grip toil the chocobos of burden here in Gridania, and no rivals will they brook.

dialogue.name: HORSEMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: Yet do they not say in the northeast, “the people are speaking, the gods are speaking”? Even the chocowackers dare not resist a groundswell of support.

dialogue.name: HORSEMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: M'ladyM'lord knows that our Eastern countenance freezes the tongue and hurries the feet. Don the uma kabuto again, for to you falls the task. The people shall speak their minds, straight to the horse's mouth!

dialogue.name: HORSEMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: Have you the black uma kabuto, m'ladym'lord? It no doubt gathers dust upon the shelf of the black uma yoriki in Ul'dah.

dialogue.name: NICOLIAUX
dialogue.text: That's a horse, right? I know all about that!

dialogue.name: NICOLIAUX
dialogue.text: It's fast, faster than anything. An adventurer from Ul'dah says he saw one─he just caught a quick look afore it disappeared, that's how fast! I want one so bad...

dialogue.name: NICOLIAUX
dialogue.text: The lady in the Amphitheatre, she's got a helm like nothing I've seen. Wish I had one...

dialogue.name: CEINGULED
dialogue.text: Well, I would be lying if I said your helm─kabuto, it is called?─if I said your kabuto was not without some appeal. It...grows on you.

dialogue.name: CEINGULED
dialogue.text: Especially since I hear the actual beast is a powerful creature. It needs some studying of course, but...any tactical advantage against the Garleans would be welcome indeed.

dialogue.name: CEINGULED
dialogue.text: Where is your strange yet glorious helm? Surely, you have one?

dialogue.name: MELLAINE
dialogue.text: Hm, is that the horse kabuto that's the talk of the town? It puts me in mind of a rare beast I saw in the hinterlands of Coerthas.

dialogue.name: MELLAINE
dialogue.text: A unicorn, they called it. I saw it just that once but you don't forget something that beautiful. Horses are beautiful, too, aren't they? What a fair sight it'd be, to have them here!

dialogue.name: MELLAINE
dialogue.text: Do you have a kabuto? I'd like to see one up close. I know they me in mind of something.

dialogue.name: CHOCOBOMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: Oh, for the love of the Twelve, the entire eveningmorningday spent dealing with inquiries about this horse thing! We deal in chocobos, people!

dialogue.name: CHOCOBOMISSIONARY
dialogue.text:
And what can I help you wi─
...Oh! ...Oh. You're one of those horse folk. Come to harass us in person, hm?

dialogue.name: CHOCOBOMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: You brought the voice of the people? What is that, some sort of a periodical? Oh. “Want one so bad,” “tactical advantage,” “What a fair sight”...

dialogue.name: CHOCOBOMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: These are just...personal opinions! You're not changing our minds with this dross!

dialogue.name: CHOCOBOMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: Eorzea has a long and proud tradition of portage. We are a chocobo-based economy, you know! This newfangled horse thing has no place here.

dialogue.name: CHOCOBOMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: Say no to alternative portage! If that uma bugyo insists on waving the horse-head on our turf, we'll bring out the big birds, you can be sure of that.

dialogue.name: CHOCOBOMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: Since you helped them, you're helping us now. I've sent for the finest chocobo Coerthas can breed. Bring that bugyo to Treespeak Stables, and we'll put her in her place.

dialogue.name: CHOCOBOMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: If you need a chocobo porter, you'll have to go next door. Ugh, I hope one of those horse-headed freaks shows up─I'll give 'em a piece of my mind!

dialogue.name: HORSEMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: M'ladyM'lord relayed the voice of the people to those high-necked chocowackers? They were suitably humbled, I assume yet ask?

dialogue.name: HORSEMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: ...And I am schooled, that an answer assumed is unlike an asking answered. Irrational and partial these chocowackers are, and they shame even the horsebird in their witlessness.

dialogue.name: HORSEMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: A chocobo-based economy, indeed! A long and proud tradition of non-competition, is what is meant by the left and the right side of her mouth alike.

dialogue.name: HORSEMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: Far have I come to stoke the flames of accord with Eorzea, m'ladym'lord, and these chocowackers would see it turn to cold ash! Nay─neigh, I say!

dialogue.name: HORSEMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: This challenge I will accept. M'ladyM'lord will guide me to this Treespeak Stables, and there I will face off against the keeper of horsebirds.

dialogue.name: HORSEMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: Quick, don the kabuto! A horse you must stay, until this labor is complete.

dialogue.name: HORSEMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: In honor and glory do we first lay eyes on each other. You are that which is called the chief of chocowackers by Eorzeans and outlanders alike. I am the uma bugyo.

dialogue.name: CHOCOBOMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: Thank you for coming, esteemed visitor from the Far East. Let's settle this thing once and for all, shall we?

dialogue.name: CHOCOBOMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: A truly magnificent chocobo is about to arrive in these stables. After that, we can both go home because it will be pretty clear even to you that we've no need of horses in Eorzea!

dialogue.name: HORSEMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: Your initial courtesy was as a thin soup before a meal of bones. You speak of things becoming clear, m'lady, but there is no clarity in your own mind─only folly.

dialogue.name: HORSEMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: Thanks to this adventurer most beautiful, fleet, and powerful, Eorzea desires to know more of the horse. Is that not clear to you?

dialogue.name: CHOCOBOMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: Excuse me!? You think a cheap stunt like that means anything? The last girlguy to put on a funny hat and clown about was selling lardy cakes, and people talked about that for a few days, too!

dialogue.name: HORSEMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: Funny hat!? A work of high art and cunning craft this is, and in the image of mine own courser fair. Oh, the scurrilousness!

dialogue.name: CHOCOBOMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: The scurry-what!? Nobody in Eorzea even understands what you're saying! As for your precious horses, they're just unicorns with a big empty forehead. Hornless! Hornless!

dialogue.name: HAURCHEFANT
dialogue.text: (-???-)Abandon your quarrel, your tongues are sharp enough to shave an urchin!

dialogue.name: HAURCHEFANT
dialogue.text: (-???-)Treespeak sends for the finest chocobo in Coerthas, and I have brought it thus... Now, what ails you that you would keep me waiting?

dialogue.name: CHOCOBOMISSIONARY
dialogue.text:
But that armor is Haurche─
...No, that can't be. Excuse me, who are you? I didn't send for a horse-head to deliver my chocobo!

dialogue.name: HAURCHEFANT
dialogue.text: Well, if you cannot name me, I have no name to claim! The helm I bought off a passing adventurer. It has a certain...vigor that appealed to me.

dialogue.name: HAURCHEFANT
dialogue.text: Esteemed visitor from the East, I have the honor to have been born under the unicorn sigil of a proud house. Horn or no, I know the love you bear for the mount of your homeland.

dialogue.name: HAURCHEFANT
dialogue.text: The supple muscles under the silky coat, the music of the hooves...the velvet of the muzzle, and the inscrutable black sea of their eyes. Ah, the horse!

dialogue.name: HAURCHEFANT
dialogue.text: But I am also a man of Coerthas, where the love of chocobos runs as deep as their bloodline runs pure. Which is better, bird or horse? I could not say.

dialogue.name: HORSEMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: You could not say? Exactly useless, then, was that soliloquy! M'lord seems not to comprehend that I am now honor-bound to prove the horse superior to this...this chit!

dialogue.name: HAURCHEFANT
dialogue.text: Then your honor is forfeit, as is hers. The finest creature here is neither the horse nor the chocobo...

dialogue.name: HAURCHEFANT
dialogue.text: ...but this adventurer!

dialogue.name: HAURCHEFANT
dialogue.text: ...but my trusted comrade of many adventures, Forename!

dialogue.name: HAURCHEFANT
dialogue.text: Look at the scars upon herhis kabuto. How mightily shehe must have toiled to become a horse...and against all odds, succeed!

dialogue.name: HAURCHEFANT
dialogue.text: The docility to accept well-nigh impossible commands, the physical talents to carry them out─to a warrior born such as I, there are no virtues greater in a steed!

dialogue.name: HAURCHEFANT
dialogue.text: I say, be my personal steed! There will be none greater, furred or feathered. The finest carrots you will have. Your feet I will scrape, and...

dialogue.name: CHOCOBOMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: Uh, Lord Haur─I mean, Lord No-name, I think you made your point. You can stop now. Please.

dialogue.name: HORSEMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: I must agree with m'lady here. If we agree to discuss the matter at some later and calmer time, m'lord, will you refrain from further flying of fancies?

dialogue.name: HAURCHEFANT
dialogue.text: Well, if you are in agreement, I see no further need for my presence here. I shall take the chocobo and return north.

dialogue.name: HAURCHEFANT
dialogue.text: Adventurer, we were well met. A womanman of your talents is welcome at our camp any time.

dialogue.name: HAURCHEFANT
dialogue.text: Forename, we were well met again. You will one day make your way back to our camp, I trust? We will sit by the fire and talk of glory and adventure!

dialogue.name: HAURCHEFANT
dialogue.text: May the new turn be a blessed one!

dialogue.name: CHOCOBOMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: You! Put that horse helm back on. I want that uma bugyo to know how peaky a horse looks next to a chocobo!

dialogue.name: HORSEMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: In rue and chagrin do I face you after such fit of temper. I tremble to think what reckless words may have tumbled from this mouth without the Ishgardian lord's interruption.

dialogue.name: HORSEMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: Curious it is how the best of intentions curdle so quickly into an act of spite. M'ladyM'lord has much to teach me in the clean-breaking ways of the rolling stone.

dialogue.name: HORSEMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: The chief of chocowackers also regrets her rash words. In tranquility and amity we have determined to meet again, to search for a two-beast solution.

dialogue.name: HORSEMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: The people have seen, the people have spoken─all thanks to m'ladym'lord. The way is open for the horse, and someday, with the chocowackers' assent, we shall canter into Eorzea.

dialogue.name: HORSEMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: Much has been asked of m'ladym'lord adventurer, yet more has been given by herhim. Accept this Heavensturn dish, traditional in the East, as a token of our friendship and promise.

dialogue.name: HORSEMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: May the new turn be a blessed one for you, for you from the Far East we pray.
